sen.j: 藤原 宮子（ふじわら の みやこ、？ - 天平勝宝6年7月19日 (旧暦)（754年8月11日））は藤原不比等の長女。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Miyako (the date of birth unknown, died on August 11, 754) was the eldest daughter of FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
FUJIWARA no Miyako (year of birth unknown - August 11, 754) was the first daughter of FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。eldest→first と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Miyako (year of birth unknown - August 11, 754) was the first daughter of FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
Her mother was Kamohime.
Her mother was Kamohime.
Her mother was Kamohime.
She became a consort of Emperor Monmu.
She became a consort of the Emperor Monmu.
She became a consort of the Emperor Monmu.

sen.j: 異母妹で聖武天皇の皇后光明皇后とは、義理の親子関係にも当たる。
sen.e: Empress Komyo, a consort of Emperor Shomu was Miyako's half-sister by a different mother as well as daughter in law.
The Empress Komyo, the empress of the Emperor Shomu was Miyako's younger paternal half-sister as well as daughter in law.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。a consort→the empress,half-sister by different mother→younger paternal half-sister,
sen.e: The Empress Komyo, the empress of the Emperor Shomu was Miyako's younger paternal half-sister as well as daughter in law.
She married Emperor Monmu in 697.
She married the Emperor Monmu in 697.
She married the Emperor Monmu in 697.

sen.j: 701年、首（おびと）皇子（後の聖武天皇）を出産したが、心的障害に陥り、その後は長く皇子に会う事はなかった。
sen.e: In 701 Miyako gave birth to Prince Obito (later Emperor Shomu), but suffering from mental illness, she did not have a chance to see her son very long.
In 701 Miyako gave birth to the Prince Obito (later the Emperor Shomu), but suffering from mental illness, she did not have a chance to see the prince for a long time.
sen.cmt: the, を補いました。スペースを修正しました、her son→the prince,very long→for a long time と修正しました。
sen.e: In 701 Miyako gave birth to the Prince Obito (later the Emperor Shomu), but suffering from mental illness, she did not have a chance to see the prince for a long time.

sen.j: 夫天皇、父不比等等肉親の死を経て、723年に従二位に叙され、首皇子が即位した翌724年には正一位、大御祖（文書では皇太夫人）の称号を受けたが病は癒えなかった。
sen.e: After the deaths of her husband, Emperor Monmu and her father FUJIWARA no Fuhito, Miyako was elevated to Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 723 and to Shoichii (Senior First Rank) as well as Oomioya (meaning the mother of the Emperor but the title in official documents was Kotaifujin (the wife of the previous retired emperor)) in 724, when her son, Prince Obito acceded to the throne, and yet it took a long time before her illness was cured.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After the deaths of her husband, the Emperor Monmu and her father FUJIWARA no Fuhito, Miyako was conferred Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 723, and Shoichii (Senior First Rank) as well as Oomioya (meaning the mother of the emperor but the title in official documents was Kotaifujin [the wife of the previous retired emperor]) in 724, when the Prince Obito acceded to the throne, and yet it took a long time before her illness was cured.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。to, her son を削除、elevated to→conferred,Emperor→emperor,スペース、カッコ内のカッコを修正しました。
sen.e: After the deaths of her husband, the Emperor Monmu and her father FUJIWARA no Fuhito, Miyako was conferred Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 723, and Shoichii (Senior First Rank) as well as Oomioya (meaning the mother of the emperor but the title in official documents was Kotaifujin [the wife of the previous retired emperor]) in 724, when the Prince Obito acceded to the throne, and yet it took a long time before her illness was cured.

sen.j: 737年にやっと平癒、息子天皇と36年ぶりに対面した。
sen.e: It was not until 737 that she recovered from her illness and managed to see her son, Emperor Shomu for the first time in 36 years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was not until 737 that she recovered from her illness, and managed to see her son, the Emperor Shomu for the first time in 36 years.
sen.cmt: カンマ、the を補いました。
sen.e: It was not until 737 that she recovered from her illness, and managed to see her son, the Emperor Shomu for the first time in 36 years.

sen.j: そして、孫阿部内親王が即位（孝謙天皇）した749年には太皇太后の称号を受け、754年に崩御した。
sen.e: When her granddaughter Imperial Princess Abe acceded to the throne and became Empress Koken in 749, Miyako was further elevated to Grand Empress Dowager, and died in 754.
When her granddaughter the Imperial Princess Abe acceded to the throne and became the Empress Koken in 749, Miyako was conferred Grand Empress Dowager, and died in 754.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。further elevated to→conferred と修正しました。
sen.e: When her granddaughter the Imperial Princess Abe acceded to the throne and became the Empress Koken in 749, Miyako was conferred Grand Empress Dowager, and died in 754.

sen.j: 享年70前後と推定される。
sen.e: It is presumed she was around 70 when she passed away.
It is presumed she was around 70 years old when she passed away.
sen.cmt: years old を補いました。
sen.e: It is presumed she was around 70 years old when she passed away.

sen.j: 長く苦しむ事となる病気にかかりながらも、跡継ぎを生み、天皇の后としての最低限の役割は果たした宮子であった。
sen.e: While fighting against her illness for a long time, Miyako fulfilled her minimum duty as a wife of an Emperor by giving birth to a prince heir.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: While fighting against her illness for a long time, Miyako fulfilled her minimum duty as an empress of an emperor by giving birth to a prince heir.
sen.cmt: a wife→an empress,Emperor→emperor と修正しました
sen.e: While fighting against her illness for a long time, Miyako fulfilled her minimum duty as an empress of an emperor by giving birth to a prince heir.

sen.j: しかし、その跡継ぎ聖武天皇には安積親王薨去後はついに男子の跡継ぎが生まれず、一族藤原氏と他氏貴族との権力闘争などもあいまって、崩御後20年も経たないうちに天武皇統は事実上断絶してしまう事となった。
sen.e: Her son, Emperor Shomu, however, failed to produce an heir after Prince Asaka died, which, coupled with power struggle between the Fujiwara Family and other noble families, practically led to the extinction of the lineage of Emperor Tenmu, only less than 20 years from the emperor's demise.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Her son, the Emperor Shomu, however, failed to produce single male heir after the Prince Asaka died, which, coupled with power struggle between the Fujiwara family and other noble families, practically led to the extinction of the lineage of the Emperor Tenmu, less than 20 years from the emperor's demise.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。an heir→single male heir,Family→family と修正しました。only を削除しました。
sen.e: Her son, the Emperor Shomu, however, failed to produce single male heir after the Prince Asaka died, which, coupled with power struggle between the Fujiwara family and other noble families, practically led to the extinction of the lineage of the Emperor Tenmu, less than 20 years from the emperor's demise.

sen.j: なお、病気回復の時に関わった僧侶が玄ボウであり、橘諸兄の元で玄昉が権力を振るったのはこの功績によるものと考えられる。
sen.e: It was a Buddhist monk, Genbo who helped Miyako recover from her illness and it is believed that the reputation earned there paved a way for the bonze to have enormous power under the patronage of TACHIBANA no Moroe.

In addition, it was a Buddhist monk, Genbo who helped Miyako to recover from her illness, and it is believed that the reputation earned there paved a way for the bonze to have enormous power under the patronage of TACHIBANA no Moroe.
sen.cmt: In addition, to, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: In addition, it was a Buddhist monk, Genbo who helped Miyako to recover from her illness, and it is believed that the reputation earned there paved a way for the bonze to have enormous power under the patronage of TACHIBANA no Moroe.
